MemberSignature.Value: public TActorInterface CreateActorProxy<TActorInterface> (Uri serviceUri, Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.ActorId actorId, string listenerName = null) where TActorInterface : Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActor;

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance !!TActorInterface CreateActorProxy<(class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActor) TActorInterface>(class System.Uri serviceUri, class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.ActorId actorId, string listenerName) cil managed

Docs.typeparam: The actor interface implemented by the remote actor object. The returned proxy object will implement this interface.
Docs.param: Actor Id of the proxy actor object. Methods called on this proxy will result in requests being sent to the actor with this id.

By default an actor service has only one listener for clients to connect to and communicate with. However it is possible to configure an actor service with more than one listeners, the listenerName parameter specifies the name of the listener to connect to.
Docs.summary: Creates a proxy to the actor object that implements an actor interface.
Docs.returns: An actor proxy object that implements and TActorInterface.

MemberSignature.Value: public TActorInterface CreateActorProxy<TActorInterface> (Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.ActorId actorId, string applicationName = null, string serviceName = null, string listenerName = null) where TActorInterface : Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActor;

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance !!TActorInterface CreateActorProxy<(class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActor) TActorInterface>(class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.ActorId actorId, string applicationName, string serviceName, string listenerName) cil managed

Docs.typeparam: The actor interface implemented by the remote actor object. The returned proxy object will implement this interface.
Docs.param: Actor Id of the proxy actor object. Methods called on this proxy will result in requests being sent to the actor with this id.

Name of the Service Fabric application that contains the actor service hosting the actor objects. This parameter can be null if the client is running as part of that same Service Fabric application. For more information, see Remarks.

Name of the Service Fabric service as configured by on the actor implementation. By default, the name of the service is derived from the name of the actor interface. However is required when an actor implements more than one actor interfaces or an actor interface derives from another actor interface as the determination of the serviceName cannot be made automatically.

By default an actor service has only one listener for clients to connect to and communicate with. However it is possible to configure an actor service with more than one listeners, the listenerName parameter specifies the name of the listener to connect to.
Docs.summary: Creates a proxy to the actor object that implements an actor interface.
Docs.returns: An actor proxy object that implements and TActorInterface.

MemberSignature.Value: public TServiceInterface CreateActorServiceProxy<TServiceInterface> (Uri serviceUri, Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.ActorId actorId, string listenerName = null) where TServiceInterface : Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.IService;

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance !!TServiceInterface CreateActorServiceProxy<(class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.IService) TServiceInterface>(class System.Uri serviceUri, class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.ActorId actorId, string listenerName) cil managed

Docs.typeparam: The service interface implemented by the actor service.
Docs.param: Uri of the actor service to connect to.
Id of the actor. The created proxy will be connected to the partition of the actor service hosting actor with this id.

By default an actor service has only one listener for clients to connect to and communicate with. However it is possible to configure an actor service with more than one listeners, the listenerName parameter specifies the name of the listener to connect to.
Docs.summary: Create a proxy to the actor service that is hosting the specified actor id and implementing specified type of the service interface.
Docs.returns: A service proxy object that implements and TServiceInterface.

Docs.typeparam: The service interface implemented by the actor service.
Docs.param: Uri of the actor service to connect to.
The key of the actor service partition to connect to.

By default an actor service has only one listener for clients to connect to and communicate with. However it is possible to configure an actor service with more than one listeners, the listenerName parameter specifies the name of the listener to connect to.
Docs.summary: Create a proxy to the actor service that is hosting the specified actor id and implementing specified type of the service interface.
Docs.returns: A service proxy object that implements and TServiceInterface.
